Question:
A boy starts at P and walks 3.0 m due north from P to Q and then 4.0 m due east from Q to R.
What is the shortest distance that he must now walk to have an overall displacement of zero?

A student investigates the motion of a ball falling through the air.
Which quantity is a vector?

Options.B: the gravitational force on the ball
Options.C: the distance from which the ball is dropped
Options.D: the speed at which the ball hits the ground

Question:
A skier slides down a slope. The diagram shows how his speed varies with time.
What is his average acceleration during the 6.0 s?

A solid object, immersed in water, hangs from an elastic thread. Three forces act on the object: its weight W, the tension in the thread T, and a force F from the water.
Which equation is correct when the object is stationary?

The diagram shows a car going around a circular track at constant speed.
Which arrow shows the direction of the resultant force on the car?

An object in a laboratory is used to determine the gravitational field strength g.
Which quantity is equal to g?

Options.C: the ( weight / mass ) of the object
Options.D: the ( mass / weight ) of the object

Question:
A student takes measurements to find the density of a regularly shaped block.
Which formula is used to calculate the density of the block?

Four solid objects are made from the same material and have equal volumes.
Which object is the most stable?

A metal wire is stretched by a force F up to the limit of proportionality.
Which statement describes what happens when F is increased slightly?

Options.B: The wire continues to extend but not in direct proportion to F.
Options.C: The wire continues to extend in direct proportion to F.
Options.D: The wire does not extend any further.

Question:
Piston X is pushed into a hydraulic cylinder. Piston X produces a pressure PX in the liquid in the cylinder.
The diagram shows the cylinder viewed from above.
There are two other pistons, Y and Z, in the cylinder.
The pressures on piston Y and Z are PY and PZ.
What is the relationship between PX, PY and PZ?

Air is trapped in a cylinder by a piston. The pressure of the air is p and the length of the air column is 20 cm.
The piston is moved outwards. The length of the air column increases by 40 cm.
The temperature of the air remains constant.
What is the new air pressure?

A 60 kg ice-skater, travelling initially at 3.0 m / s, glides across a horizontal icy surface. The skater brakes and comes to rest after 5.0 m.
The work done against the braking force is the change in the kinetic energy of the skater.
What is the braking force?
Which equation is used to find the efficiency of an energy transfer?

Options.A: efficiency = useful energy output / total energy input
Options.B: efficiency = total energy input / useful energy output
Options.C: efficiency = energy converted to the required form / total power input
Options.D: efficiency = (energy converted to the required form) x (total energy input)

Question:
The diagram shows the inside of a refrigerator.
When the refrigerator is first switched on, what happens to the air near the cooling unit?
What is the colour and what is the texture of a good absorber of infrared radiation?
Which temperatures are used as the lower and upper fixed points for a mercury-in-glass thermometer?

Two liquid-in-glass thermometers have identical dimensions. One contains ethanol and the other an equal volume of mercury.
One contains ethanol and the other an equal volume of mercury.
Ethanol expands more than mercury for the same temperature rise.
How do the sensitivity and range of the ethanol thermometer compare to those of the mercury thermometer?

Solar panels are used to heat water with a mass of 500 kg.
The total area of the solar panels is 10 m^2 and the average power output from each square metre of the panels is 300 W.The specific heat capacity of water is 4200 J / (kg °C).
What is the increase in the water temperature after 8.0 hours?(Assume there is no heat loss.)

The graph is the temperature-time graph for a sample of wax that is heated so that it melts.
The mass of the wax is 200 g. Thermal energy is supplied to the wax at a constant rate of 12 000 J / minute.
What is the specific latent heat of fusion of the wax?

The temperatures of the water in four beakers are different and areas of the surfaces of the water are also different.
In which beaker is the rate of evaporation of the water greatest?

The diagram shows one wavefront of a wave as it travels from deep water to shallow water in a ripple tank.
What happens as the wavefront moves into the shallow water?

Options.A: The speed of the wavefront increases.
Options.B: The speed of the wavefront decreases.
Options.C: The wavelength of the wave remains constant.
Options.D: The wavelength of the wave increases.

Question: Which example describes a transverse wave being refracted?

Options.A: infrared waves travelling in an optical fibre
Options.B: light waves from an object entering a magnifying glass
Options.C: ultrasound waves being used to clean jewellery

Question:
Light reflects from a plane mirror as shown.
Which row is always correct?

A piece of paper torn from an exercise book is shown.
Which process is being described?

Options.A: the formation of a virtual image by a diverging lens
Options.B: the formation of a virtual image by a converging lens
Options.C: the formation of a real image by a diverging lens
Options.D: the formation of a real image by a converging lens

Question:
A girl is long-sighted.
Which statement is correct?

Options.A: She sees close objects less clearly than a person with normal vision.
Options.B: She sees distant objects more clearly than a person with normal vision.
Options.C: The fault is corrected with a diverging lens.
Options.D: The image of a close object is formed in front of her retina.

Question:
Light rays are deviated by a prism.
The deviation angle d is measured for light rays of different frequency, including blue light and red light.
Which graph of d against frequency is correct?

A satellite orbits the Earth at a height of 300 km above the surface. The speed of electromagnetic waves is 3.0 x 10^8 m / s.
What is the minimum time taken for a radio signal transmitted from the Earth to reach the satellite?
Which of the following is most closely associated with echoes?

An ultrasound scanner produces an image of an unborn baby.
What does the scanner use to form an image of the baby?

A small plotting compass is placed near to a bar magnet as shown.
Which diagram shows the direction in which the compass needle points?

A positively charged plastic rod is held near but not touching an insulated and previously uncharged metal ball. No charge leaves the rod.
What are possible charges on the left-hand side and right-hand side of the ball?
Which circuit is connected to measure the current in the fixed resistor and the potential difference (p.d.) across the same resistor?

Quantity X and quantity Y have the same unit Z.
X is the energy dissipated by a battery in driving unit charge round the complete circuit.
Y is the work done in a component in driving unit charge through the component.
What are X, Y and Z?

A transformer with an efficiency of 100% has a primary voltage input of 600 V and a secondary voltage output of 240 V. The secondary coil is attached to a resistor of resistance 120 Ω.
What is the power dissipated in the resistor and what is the current in the primary coil?

The diagram shows an alarm system in which the switch S is shown closed. The top circuit is arranged so that the electromagnet is positioned over the soft iron contact.
What happens when the switch S is opened?

The diagram shows an LED connected in a circuit with a resistor and an a.c. power supply of frequency 2.0 Hz.
Which statement is correct?

Options.B: The LED flashes on twice each second and off twice each second.
Options.C: The LED flashes on four times each second and off four times each second.
Options.D: The LED stays on all the time.

Question: Which statement about the production of electricity in a nuclear power station is correct?

Options.A: In the reactor, the main reaction occurs when protons hit uranium nuclei.
Options.B: The process taking place in the reactor is called nuclear fusion.
Options.C: The reactor produces energy to boil water and to produce steam.
Options.D: Carbon dioxide is the major waste product from the reactor.

Question:
A radioactive sample contains an isotope that emits alpha particles.
Which quantity stays constant?

Options.C: the number of neutrons in the sample
Options.D: the rate of decay of the isotope

Question:
In the simple model of an atom, X orbits around Y.
What are X and Y?
How do the proton numbers (atomic numbers) and the nucleon numbers (mass numbers) of two different isotopes of the same element compare with each other?
